intro: Echium onosmifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Echium onosmifolium is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
